showScoreExcerpt:
“The art of hair braiding stretches back thousands of years across African culture...Playwright Jocelyn Bioh provides a colorful look at these traditions being carried forward at the small but bright Harlem salon known as ‘Jaja’s African Hair Braiding’...And though the play takes place in 2019, its underlying themes are as old as time: lost love, false hopes, dreams deferred.”
